job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in New Lenox, IL
pros: A large portion of staff are friendly & helpful. My manager actually cares & listens. My manager will also help out on the floor when asked. Hospital is well maintained, & modern looking. IT is helpful & nice. Security is helpful at defusing rowdy patients. The phlebotomy & patient transport departments are a God send/time saver. Commute isn't that bad. Fidelity - they match up to 8%. Occasionally the unit has a clerk. Majority of the time, the charge nurse doesn't have any patients.
cons: CEO & her high up minions will attempt to suck you dry. They always want more for less hospital-wide. They put patient & staff safety over profits. Pay is suboptimal compared to surrounding hospitals. You thought pizza parties were bad, they give out a $3 coupon off your meal in the cafeteria/Starbucks. (E.g. I got a $3 coupon as a reward for doing the work of 2 RNs bc we were so short staffed). Nurse educator on the floor isn't very helpful. They added 50+ new beds, but didn't have the staff to the ones they already had. They CONSTANTLY ask staff for donations. (E.g. They recently they asked staff to donate gym shoes. The shoe profits were going to buy the cardiovascular gym a new treadmill.) Medical insurance coverage stinks & I have their best plan. Always short staffed.

job_title: Doctor of Physical Therapy in New Lenox, IL
pros: The people are nice. The benefits are good.
cons: Salary does not increase . HR does not do anything about grievances . Does not reimburse for continuing education. Opportunities are not given unless requested .

job_title: Registered Nurse in New Lenox, IL
pros: They will try to make it like a family environment like every corporation, then give you a .20 to .50 cent raise, then promptly repeatedly ask you to pick up extra shifts for the team. They have good 401k match of 7% +1% if the hospital does well in a year.
cons:
They are a "small community hospital" that banks a large chunk of change "53 million after expenses in 2020" and spends it on expansion and not on their employee's for retention. 

The raises are small and they take away a portion of the raise if the hospital doesn't achieve patient satisfaction scores. Even if that has nothing to do with you or your department.

The pay doesn't match hospitals which are unionized in area as well, this hospital stays below.

We are constantly short staffed across hospital, but administration will buy you a branded cheap coffee cup, towel, or travel mug for Nurse day to show you how much they care.

job_title: Insurance in New Lenox, IL
pros: A paycheck and medical insurance
cons: Horrible working conditions Management the worst Ive ever experience! inappropriate actions going on no one cared just worried about there job! People talked about by management and be little in meetings it's sad when you need a job to provide for your family and have to come in hating and scared of losing it every day..Poor atmosphere and employee turn over, way to much expectations on employees for productivity each day couldn't even get up to go the bathroom and always eating at your desk..When i started there this was not even a vision i thought would be but it turned out to be my worst nightmare.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in New Lenox, IL
pros: More involved with situations going on and have actual input. Training is more extensive then most security jobs. Co workers are for the majority very nice and happy.
cons: Real world situations are not taken serious as far as safety. Medically such as disasters they are, but not for someone who is looking to do harm with a weapon. So I guess you could say that when it comes to real issues it's hard to get full attention when it's not medical.

job_title: RN L&D in New Lenox, IL
pros: Benefits are good, unfortunately as we in the healthcare industry know, we don't get the best anyhow!  Salary, competitive.  Small workout room for employees to use 24/7, shared with the cardiac and weight management program patients.
cons: Clicks!  Long term employee's are granted cart Blanche, cannot be questioned in regard to evidence based practice.  I can only speak to the unit I was orientated on...lack of  planning to approach orientation in a systematic format, micro-management of basic nursing process, then held accountable for knowledge of documentation, which changes daily dependent on preceptor.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in New Lenox, IL
pros:
very friendly and supportive co-workers, good teamwork
management listens to staff concerns
enjoyable place to work
can pick from 4hr, 8hr, or 12hr shifts
cons:
Cafe and cafeteria had weird hours, bring your own food!
Empty promises, HR told me that they will work with me to get a RN job here since I worked there as a CNA , and to not worry about whether or not there are open positions, then got told that they "ran out" of spots for new grads and that I won't be hired.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Lenox, IL
pros: I have worked in 3 different large health systems in the area, and can say this place is wonderful to work at. The people make the organization, and the culture is very positive and administrator/leadership is supportive. I would reccomend anyone wanting to learn and get pulled into different things to check this place out. Definitely opportunities here to grow and my experience has been very positive.
cons: Technology is definitely lacking here. Outdated Microsoft Outlook platform, but clinical technology is adequate. More/updated tech is needed on the business side.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in New Lenox, IL
pros: Not a bad place to work. Managing styles vary by units.  It's relatively easy to move to another department. There is often opportunity to pick up hours even on other floors.
cons: I took a pay cut coming here. Overall they pay less than most other hospitals. Not sure why. The Dr.s here leave much to be desired. Most are still not placing their own orders in even though they are supposed to. Good luck getting call backs from them too.  Too many of the MD's are just plain rude and try to avoid staff.  The computer system is a cheap version of Cerner. It's not efficient. Maybe that's why the drs don't put their orders in?

review_title: Finally paid well at the end

cons: Management picks favorites and blames staff rather than taking ownership for failures at the organizational level.

job_title: Emergency Room Nurse in New Lenox, IL

cons: Management is horrible at communicating; created an environment where you felt your concerns weren't heard or cared for.
